snippet: A NEW campaign promoting California as a destination for cultural tourism goes beyond the obvious beacons like the Getty Center in Los Angeles. One suggested stop is the Thai Plaza on Hollywood Boulevard, where a Thai Elvis performs on Tuesday nig...
lead_paragraph: A NEW campaign promoting California as a destination for cultural tourism goes beyond the obvious beacons like the Getty Center in Los Angeles. One suggested stop is the Thai Plaza on Hollywood Boulevard, where a Thai Elvis performs on Tuesday nights for throngs of Asian regulars. The Thai Plaza is listed in ''On the Edge,'' one of 13 itineraries included in a 32-page advertising insert that is the foundation of a $3 million promotion by the year-old California Cultural Tourism Coalition. Last year, the group received a $150,000 grant from the National Endowment for the Arts, which supported the project as a national model.
abstract: Advertising campaign promoting California as destination for cultural tourism has been designed by Garza Group for California Cultural Tourism Coalition (L)

headline.main: California, taking a cue from other regions, plans a specialized promotion for cultural tourism.
